attributes.action: Limited MPs pay rise to the average for public sector workets
attributes.additional_details: By not taking this or similar actions MPs will continue to distance themselves from the communities they serve.  This has serious consequences for the credibility of Government in the eyes of the public.
attributes.background: With austerity public sector pay rises were non existent or minimal and yet MPs continued to vote themselves above inflation pay rises. MPs should lead by example and limit their pay rises to that of the an average piblic sector worker

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
